main event: A round, bright white object was observed on radar traveling at a high rate of speed across the sky over the East Indies.
interesting points: The object appeared as bright as a second magnitude star and made an intermittent whining sound.
The object was under observation for approximately 1.2 minutes before disappearing into clouds on the horizon.
The object's course was tracked from a bearing of 039 degrees to a bearing of 023 degrees, with no observed maneuvers.
The sighting was made by several reliable military witnesses, including an Air Force lieutenant colonel and Navy officers.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting included good visibility of 64 miles and minimal cloud cover.
